revised_title: Diurnal Variations of Wind and Barometric Pressure at Bombay
tldr: This paper investigates the relationship between diurnal wind and barometric variations in Bombay. The author analyzes wind and temperature data from 1867 to 1870, finding that the land and sea breezes follow Halley's theory of trade-winds. The study also reveals a double diurnal variation in the general movements of the atmosphere, which is used to deduce typical wind and barometric variations in different latitudes.
